author: Flaminia Luck
title: Katie Price arrested at Heathrow Airport and to appear in court tomorrow - LBC
text: [ Clive Bull ](/radio/presenters/clive-bull/) 1am - 4am Katie Price arrested at Heathrow Airport and due to appear in court today 8 August 2024, 22:12 | Updated: 9 August 2024, 05:39 TV personality and former glamour model Katie Price has been arrested at Heathrow Airport following her return to the UK from Turkey. Listen to this article Loading audio... A warrant for the 46-year-old's arrest had been issued last month after she failed to attend court last week for a hearing relating to her bankruptcies. Price remains in custody and is due to appear in court on Friday, police authorities confirmed. On Thursday, the mum-of-five shared a statement on Instagram, saying she had been visiting Turkey to film a documentary. She revealed that when returning from work she would be "detained at the airport" as the "courts feel is necessary". When speaking about her 22-year-old son Harvey, who accompanied her to Turkey, she requested that they "allow some dignity and protection for at least his sake as this will be extremely disturbing for him to see". When acknowledging the "severity" of the matter, Price added she was being treated "like a criminal" and said the "unfortunate financial circumstance" did not mean she was a "criminal or bad person". Read More: [Britain's oldest rioter, 69, and man bitten on backside by police dog jailed as crackdown on far-right continues](https://www.lbc.co.uk/news/britains-oldest-rioter-jailed-riots/) Read More: [British doctor missing in French mountains sent desperate text to family telling them he'd 'fallen and couldn't move'](https://www.lbc.co.uk/news/british-doctor-missing-france-pyrenees-tom-doherty/) Speaking with defiance, she said she was "not embarrassed or ashamed" about the arrest, adding that her bankruptcy was due to "serious mental health issues and breakdowns from PTSD". She went on to add that she would be paying off her debts, and wished that for "Harvey's sake it's handled with care and compassion."It comes after she was told to pay £25,000 after being declared bankrupt two times. A judge at a previous hearing said Price risked being arrested if she did not go to further court dates, saying that evidence would be needed if she was not present. When issuing her arrest warrant, Judge Burton said she had "failed to attend today's hearing" and had provided no explanation for her absence. She said: "It is in my judgment necessary that the court issue a warrant for Ms Price's arrest."She has no real excuse in failing to attend today's hearing." She continued: "The reason for her absence today is irrelevant."Judge Burton said the arrest warrant was not issued "lightly" but Price had given only "piecemeal co-operation" and did not provide the "most basic information" regarding her bankruptcies. Beforehand, she was given an eviction notice that told her to leave her Mucky Mansion by the end of May, and went on to move into a Tudor-style property costing £5,000 per month. In March, she was declared bankrupt a second time due to an unpaid tax bill of £761,994.05, after initially being declared bankrupt in 2019. But at the end of July she insisted "everything is sorted" regarding her second bankruptcy having been evicted from her Sussex home. She jetted off to Turkey on 29 July, and shared a photo of herself on the plane just a few hours before her court hearing the following day. In Turkey she had her sixth face lift, which cost £10,000.It's thought she had the face lift at the Trio Clinic in Istanbul, with work done on her eyes and under her chin. She also underwent another dental procedure, and shared photos of new veneers on Wednesday. On Instagram, she posted snaps of her new dental work, wearing sunglasses with the name of the dental surgery 'Dentica' on. In a statement, the Metropolitan Police said: "A 46-year-old woman from Surrey was arrested at Heathrow Airport at 19:45hrs on Thursday, 8 August for failing to appear at court. "She has been remanded in custody at a west London police station to appear at the Royal Courts of Justice tomorrow, Friday, 9 August."

author: @PublimetroMX
title: CDMX exhorta a dar refugio a perritos callejeros ante bajas temperaturas
text:
Ante las bajas temperaturas que han azotado a la Ciudad de México debido a la llegada de un frente frío, el secretario general del Partido Verde CDMX, Jesús Sesma, hizo un llamado a cuidar a los [animales de compañía](https://www.publimetro.com.mx/noticias/2024/11/20/congreso-cdmx-reforzara-operacion-de-guarderias-para-animales-de-compania/), sobre todo de los callejeros que se encuentran en grave peligro por el cambio brusco de temperatura.
Por ello, el legislador del PVEM exhortó a todos los capitalinos para que tomen las precauciones necesarias para proteger a sus animales de compañía de los riesgos derivados de las condiciones climáticas extremas.
El líder animalista afirmó que es nuestra responsabilidad como sociedad proteger a los seres más vulnerables, y nuestras mascotas no son la excepción; además destacó que el [bienestar animal ](https://www.publimetro.com.mx/noticias/2024/04/01/cdmx-no-registrar-a-tu-mascota-en-el-ruac-multa-de-3100-pesos-y-36-horas-de-arresto/)debe ser una prioridad, sobre todo en situaciones de emergencia climática.
¿Cómo proteger a los animales?
[Jesús Sesma ](https://www.publimetro.com.mx/noticias/2024/09/03/congreso-cdmx-designa-a-jesus-sesma-como-nuevo-presidente-de-la-jucopo/)aseguró que los animales que viven en la calle o que no cuentan con un espacio adecuado para resguardarse son los que corren más peligro, por lo que recomendó:
- Brindar a los animales de compañía un refugio cálido y seguro
- Dar suficiente comida y agua fresca
- Evitar que permanezcan expuestas a las inclemencias del tiempo por períodos prolongados
- Considerar ofrecerles refugios temporales o contactar a asociaciones protectoras de animales para recibir ayuda.
El Partido Verde también hizo un llamado a las autoridades locales para que intensifiquen las campañas de sensibilización y apoyo a los animales en situación de calle, promoviendo la colaboración de la ciudadanía en su protección durante la temporada invernal.
El frío extremo no solo afecta a las personas, sino que pone en riesgo la vida de nuestros compañeros de cuatro patas.

author: Staff Report
title: Clerk arrested in theft of lottery tickets from Circle K in The Villages
text: A clerk has been arrested in the theft of lottery tickets from a Circle K convenience store in The Villages. The store manager at the Circle K at 3431 Southern Trace at Southern Trace Plaza was conducting an inventory on Wednesday morning and discovered that the store was $150 short on revenue from Florida Lottery tickets, according to an arrest report from the Sumter County Sheriff’s Office. The manager checked the in-store surveillance that showed the night shift employee, 41-year-old Vairley Ann Nickerson of The Villages, taking $170 worth of scratch-off tickets. She concealed the tickets in a garbage bag as she cleaned. At the end of her shift she cashed out a single $20 winning ticket. Nickerson was taken into custody when she showed up for the night shift on Wednesday. At the time of her arrest, she was found to be in possession of methamphetamine. She was taken into custody and booked on charges of theft and drug possession at the Sumter County Detention Center. Bond was set at $2,500.

author: iheart.com
title: Red Flag Warnings Issued For Several Mass. Communities After Dry Stretch | WBZ NewsRadio 1030
text:
Photo: WBZ NewsRadio
LYNN, Mass. (WBZ NewsRadio) — Red flag warnings were issued across Massachusetts on Friday because of extremely dry conditions across the state.
The red flag warnings come as residents in Lynn and surrounding communities try to get rid of the smell of smoke from their homes as brush fires continue to burn in the area.
The affected counties include Middlesex, Norfolk, Suffolk, and Plymouth.
“I woke up yesterday morning and I thought my house was on fire, but it was the heavy smoke,” said one resident.
“It was scary breathing in all that smoke, too close to home,” said another resident.
Firefighters on the North Shore are continuing to fight fires and are working to prevent any more hot spots from getting out of control.
Read More: Boston Hilton Workers Ratify New Union Contract
The Boston region is in a state of severe drought, with a lack of rainfall creating dry conditions that haven’t been seen in the area in about two years.
According to the National Weather Service, a Red Flag Warning means the combination of temperatures, very low humidities, and stronger winds could produce an increased risk of fire danger.
The Red Flag warnings will be in effect until 7 p.m. on Friday.
WBZ NewsRadio’s James Rojas ( @JamesRojasMMJ ) reports.
Follow WBZ NewsRadio: Facebook | Twitter | Instagram | iHeartmedia App | TikTok

organizations.name: Boston Hilton Workers Ratify New Union

author: Phil Nickinson
title: Amazon simplifies its lineup with the new Fire TV Stick HD | Digital Trends
text:
It’s a little hard to believe we’ve gone through most of 2024 without a new Amazon Fire TV Stick. That is, until now. The Fire TV Stick HD has been announced, with the $35 device reducing the Fire TV Stick lineup from four to three and in the process replacing the two oldest sticks in the family. The $40 Fire TV Stick and the $30 Fire TV Stick Lite will still be around while they’re in stock. But after that, they’re gone.
The other two current devices remain the second-generation Fire TV Stick 4K , and the second-gen Fire TV Stick 4K Max , which we still consider to be the best Fire TV Stick to get .
Recommended Videos There’s not a ton to write home about here. The Fire TV Stick HD, as the name implies, tops out at 1080p. It does support HDR , HDR 10, HDR10+, and HLG , but there’s no Dolby Vision , or Dolby Atmos for audio, for that matter. (It does support HDMI passthrough of Dolby-encoded audio, though.) It comes with the basic Alexa Voice remote, uses the older Wi-Fi 5 (that’s 802.11ac) standard, and has just 8GB of storage for apps and movies or whatever, along with 1GB of RAM . It’ll work with Amazon’s Luna cloud gaming service, but not Xbox Game Pass.
Related JBL wants you to ditch your soundbar for its affordable new home theater lineup LG rolls out its gamer-friendly M4 wireless OLED TV Nit Nerds News: Exciting new Apple TV 4K features, new Xbox consoles And it’s still using Micro USB for power. In 2024.
It’s also lacking other Fire TV OS features like the Ambient Experience , which allows for AI-generated artwork, and you won’t even get picture-in-picture support on this stick.
So this stick’s as much about Amazon consolidating things at the low end as it is anything else. Good for a spare room, perhaps, but probably not for your living room.
Editors’ Recommendations Hisense prices its 65-inch CanvasTV way less than The Frame Apple TV’s InSight feature is ready to take on Amazon Prime Video’s X-Ray Game Pass is coming to your Amazon Fire TV, even if you don’t own an Xbox Apple apes a major Amazon Prime Video feature in tvOS 18 Samsung adds new sizes to its microLED TV lineup — and they start at $110K

author: La Presse Canadienne
title: Le BST salue la maîtrise des règles de sécurité de naufragés à Terre-Neuve
text:
L’équipage d’un bateau de pêche terre-neuvien qui avait passé plusieurs jours à la dérive dans un radeau de sauvetage l’année dernière a suivi les bonnes pratiques de sécurité avant et après l’incendie du navire, selon le Bureau de la sécurité des transports du Canada.
Dans un rapport publié mercredi, le BST souligne que ses enquêtes révèlent souvent une «faible culture de sécurité» à bord des bateaux de pêche commerciale. Or, ce n’était pas le cas du capitaine et des six membres d’équipage de l’«Elite Navigator», qui a coulé à environ 240 km des côtes aux premières heures du 18 juillet 2024, indique le rapport.
«Le bateau transportait plus d’équipement de sécurité que ne l’exigeait la réglementation, et le capitaine et les membres d’équipage avaient pour pratique de discuter des scénarios et des interventions en cas d’urgence», lit-on dans le rapport du BST. «Pendant l’événement, ils ont aussi démontré des concepts issus de la formation sur la sécurité, en particulier leur utilisation de l’équipement de sauvetage.»
Une alarme s’est déclenchée sur le bateau le 17 juillet 2024, quelques instants après que le capitaine eut communiqué par radio avec la côte pour annoncer qu’ils rentraient chez eux après une sortie de pêche au turbot. Le capitaine a remarqué de la fumée provenant de la salle des machines et un autre membre d’équipage a vu des flammes dans les conduits d’échappement, qui contenaient les tuyaux d’échappement du moteur principal et du générateur, selon le rapport.
Comme le bateau a ensuite coulé, les enquêteurs n’ont pas pu déterminer la cause de l’incendie. L’équipage n’avait aucun moyen de fermer rapidement la salle des machines et de déployer un système d’extinction d’incendie au dioxyde de carbone (CO2), mais ce système n’était pas exigé par la réglementation et son utilisation n’était donc soumise à aucune règle, ont indiqué les enquêteurs.
«Si les bateaux de pêche sont équipés de systèmes au CO2, il est important que ces systèmes soient conçus de manière optimale pour les situations d’urgence, précise le BST. Par exemple, la ventilation de la salle des machines doit pouvoir être scellée rapidement.»
Les tentatives de lutte contre les flammes ayant échoué, un membre d’équipage a saisi cinq combinaisons d’immersion – tout ce qu’il pouvait transporter – et les a remises à ses compagnons. Deux autres hommes ont été piégés par les flammes à l’avant du bateau, selon le rapport.
Le capitaine a lancé des appels de détresse à l’aide du radiotéléphone VHF et du dispositif d’appel sélectif numérique VHF du bateau, mais le rapport indique que le navire était tellement loin au large qu’il était impossible que les signaux parviennent directement aux autorités des Services de communications et de trafic maritimes.
Cependant, le rapport indique qu’un radiotéléphone à moyenne fréquence, disponible à bord du bateau mais non utilisé, a une portée plus longue et aurait pu transmettre les appels de détresse avec succès.
«Voilà pourquoi il est important que les marins connaissent les capacités des divers dispositifs d’alerte de détresse afin de pouvoir utiliser le dispositif qui convient le mieux au scénario donné», souligne le BST.
Les cinq hommes en combinaison ont sauté dans l’eau glaciale, où les vagues atteignaient trois mètres de hauteur. Deux d’entre eux ont nagé jusqu’aux membres d’équipage bloqués à l’avant et les ont aidés à descendre du bateau et à monter dans les radeaux de sauvetage.
Ils dérivaient dans le radeau depuis plus de 50 heures lorsqu’ils ont aperçu un hélicoptère et des lumières provenant d’un bateau voisin et ont déclenché leur dernière fusée éclairante, selon le rapport. L’hélicoptère a perçu le signal et la Garde côtière canadienne les a secourus peu après.

author: @foxweather
title: See it: Beer truck overturns in California dumping cases in the snow
text:
00:08 PLACER COUNTY, Calif. – While hundreds of cases of beer on ice may sound like a dream, it was a nightmare for one truck driver who lost a load of beer on an icy mountain interstate Monday.
"Don't get any ideas," wrote the California Highway Patrol on social media after the crash Monday morning . "This scene will be cleaned up."
The CHP had to close three miles of westbound I-80 and reroute traffic for over an hour to clean up a beer spill. The truck hit an icy patch and overturned, spilling Coors Light across the highway and snow in the California mountains.
The Golden State saw a very late-season snow storm over the weekend. The nearby Central Sierra Snow Lab got 26.4 inches of snow on May 5, which made the spring day the snowiest of the entire "winter" season.
HOW TO WATCH FOX WEATHER
"Apparently the mountains aren’t turning blue, but the cans are," joked the CHP referring to the mountains on the beer can turning blue when cold. "Icy roads didn’t stop this driver from popping the top and emptying more than a few."
Unfortunately for the driver, the beer featuring the Rocky Mountains now chilled out on the Sierra Nevada.
The driver and passenger were treated for minor injuries at a hospital and released, according to local media.
The CHP had another unusual clean up just a week earlier. This one a stickier situation near Fresno . Early on May 1, one truck hit another delivering several honey bee boxes.
WATCH: BEES SWARM NEW YORK'S TIMES SQUARE
next Image 1 of 4
prev next Image 2 of 4
prev next Image 3 of 4
prev Image 4 of 4 "Un-BEE-lievable scene overnight as a truck carrying a shipment of BEE boxes was struck, scattering thousands of buzzing bees and their homes all over the highway near Selma," the CHP posted. "Our officers were stuck in a sticky situation for almost an hour with thousands of swarming worker bees."
The bee boxes smashed open across the highway. Upset worker bees buzzed around human workers for over an hour as officers loaded the bees onto another truck.
The CHP told local media that thousands of bees were saved. This driver did not have weather to blame.
Tags Transportation Winter Weather California

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: The Future of Athletic Training at UHS
text: The Athletic Students Training Program at University High School (UHS), initiated by head athletic trainer Julia Cendejas, is providing students interested in sports medicine with invaluable hands-on experience. Launched last year with just two students, participation has surged to about ten, with expectations of further growth as interest in the program increases. Students learn essential skills including basic anatomy, injury treatment, rehabilitation protocols, and practical applications like taping and ice bag preparation. The program stands out for its flexible, self-driven participation model, allowing students to coordinate their training around their schedules. By the Numbers- Program began with 2 students in the previous year. - Current enrollment is about 10 students, with expectations for growth. - The program operates without a fixed meeting schedule or membership requirements. - Students interested in participating independently express their interest and coordinate with the trainer. As interest grows, Cendejas hopes to expand the program further, potentially leading to the establishment of a comprehensive sports medicine curriculum at UHS. With additional student involvement, there may be enhanced athletic training support for UHS teams. Bottom LineThe establishment of the Athletic Students Training Program at UHS not only equips students with hands-on experience in sports medicine but also lays the groundwork for a more robust athletic training program, advocating the importance of this field in high school athletics. Read more at Sword & Shield The summary of the linked article was generated with the assistance of artificial intelligence technology from OpenAI

author: Admin
title: Seamless Travel: India Online Visa Welcomes Colombian, Azerbaijani, Barbadian, and Belarusian Citizens
text:
Celebrating its abundant cultural heritage and varied landscapes, India joyfully declares the broadening of its online visa initiative to encompass individuals from Colombia, Azerbaijan, Barbados, and Belarus. This expansion signifies a noteworthy stride in advancing cultural interchange and nurturing robust international connections. The Indian E-Visa initiative enables citizens of these countries to secure travel authorization for diverse reasons, spanning tourism, business, medical visits, and beyond. India endeavors to provide a more seamless and easily accessible avenue for individuals from these nations to delve into the nation’s historical wonders, lively traditions, and awe-inspiring natural wonders by simplifying the visa application process.
INDIAN VISA FOR COLOMBIA CITIZENS
Since 2014, the Indian government has provided an online visa application form for citizens of Colombia. The India visa is now accessible in 169 countries worldwide and has played a pivotal role in boosting India’s tourism economy in recent times. With the introduction of
Indian visas for Colombia citizens, they can now engage in travel for leisure, business, or medical purposes, with the entire process conveniently completed online.
Currently, there are three types of India e-Visas, each featuring distinct validity periods and entry requirements. Notably, the India Tourist e-Visa is designed for visiting friends and family or attending yoga retreats. Valid for one year, it permits two entries into India, with a maximum stay of 90 days on each entry. The Business e-visa for working in India covers activities like business meetings, sales or exchanges, tour guiding, recruitment, or conference participation, among others. This visa allows double entry for a maximum of 180 days and is valid for one year.
Additionally, the Medical visa for India caters to travelers seeking short-term medical treatment, allowing a maximum stay of 60 days and permitting three entries. The online application form is user-friendly and can be completed from any location worldwide in just 10 minutes.
INDIAN VISA FOR AZERBAIJAN CITIZENS
Similar to numerous other nations, the Indian government extends the provision of an e-Visa to Azerbaijani citizens, enabling them to seek electronic travel authorization for various purposes. Azerbaijanis are eligible to travel to India for leisure, business, or medical treatment through this electronic visa system. Since 2014, Azerbaijani nationals have had the opportunity to apply for an electronic visa specifically for India.
For leisure purposes, some citizens may opt for the government-issued India Tourist e-Visa, which allows a visit for up to 30 days, primarily intended for sightseeing and other recreational activities. This visa permits two entries during its validity period. Alternatively, those holding an e-business visa can enter India for a total duration of 365 days, with a maximum stay of 180 days, specifically for business visits or commercial activities within the country and not for employment purposes.
Furthermore, the E-Medical Visa is tailored for individuals seeking medical treatment in India, permitting a stay of up to 60 days. This encompasses medical activities such as yoga, physical therapy, complex anatomy procedures, or treatment of various illnesses. Azerbaijani citizens can conveniently obtain an Indian Visa from the comfort of their homes, with the prerequisite of preparing the necessary documents before applying for the Indian e-Visa.
INDIAN VISA FOR BARBADOS CITIZENS
Few countries in the world leave an enduring impression on visitors like India. India has more layers of history and civilization than any other country. To visit India for nearly any reason, Barbadians can apply for an Indian e-Visa. Citizens of over 169 countries can apply for these e-Visas for India. Since 2014, the Indian government has made an online application form for Indian visas for Barbadians available. The India e-Visa is a legal document that allows Barbadian nationals to travel to India for leisure, business, and other purposes. Tourist Electronic Visa: This e-Visa is valid in India for vacations, sightseeing, and other tourism-related activities. This visa only allows for multiple entrances, and travelers can stay for up to 30 days in total. There are two long-term e-Visas issued by the Government of India that allow Barbadians to enter the country frequently. The 1-year and 5-year electronic tourist visas allow multiple entries into the country for 1 year and 5 years, with each stay not exceeding 90 days. e-Business Visa – If they hold this type of visa, they are allowed to enter India for a total of 365 days with a limit of 180 days for each stay. However, this visa category cannot be used for employment purposes. Electronic Medical Visa: This can be used if they need medical treatment such as physical therapy, complex anatomy, or curing of diseases in India.They have a maximum stay of 60 days in India, with three entry permits during that period. Citizens of Barbados who meet the visa requirements can apply for an Indian e-Visa. Indian Visa Application for Barbados Citizens is a simple process that can be completed from anywhere.
INDIAN VISA FOR BELARUS CITIZENS
Belarusians, armed with an internet-connected computer or smartphone, possess the flexibility to apply for an Indian e-Visa from any location. This visa option is open to citizens of more than 169 countries, Belarus included. Similar to individuals from various nations, Belarusians have the opportunity to seek an India e-Visa by applying to the Indian government. Since 2014, the Indian government has facilitated an online application form for Belarusian citizens seeking Indian visas.
This development opens the door for Belarusians to travel to India for diverse reasons, encompassing tourism, business engagements, and medical care. The Tourist e-Visa is specifically designed for tourism-related activities such as travel and sightseeing, allowing a stay of up to 30 days with the possibility of returning. Additionally, there are extended options with 1-year and 5-year tourist e-Visas, providing Belarusian citizens the flexibility to stay in India for more extended periods.
For those engaged in business activities, the E-Business Visa permits entry into the Republic of India for a total duration of 365 days, with each stay capped at 180 days. This visa is suitable for business trips or commercial activities within the country but not for employment purposes. The E-Medical Visa caters to those seeking medical treatment in India, including activities like yoga, physical therapy, complex medical procedures, or disease treatment, allowing a stay of up to 60 days with three entries.
Once equipped with all the necessary documents, Belarusians can initiate the India e-Visa Application Form to facilitate their travel plans.

author: @Vijestime
title: Early intervention, better potential: Project for children with disabilities launched in Nikšić
text:
At least ten children with developmental disabilities and their families, beneficiaries of the services of the Association for Assistance to Persons with Disabilities in Psychophysical Development (UZPD) Nikšić, will have the opportunity to receive professional treatment and attend workshops aimed at strengthening their potential and inclusion, all as part of the project "Early intervention for better functionality of children with disabilities", which the Association is implementing.
The project will, as the president of the Association said at a press conference, Miluša Cica Žugić, psychological, speech therapy and physiotherapy individual treatments will be organized for ten children up to seven years of age, while lectures on the importance of early intervention, which can contribute to increasing the potential of their children for regular functioning in society, will be organized for at least 15 parents/guardians through social support workshops.
"The overall goal of the project is increased socialization, integration and strengthening of the potential of children with disabilities and developmental difficulties. The project is focused on providing concrete assistance to children and their families through a multidisciplinary approach, with an emphasis on timely action. The psychological, communication, social and motor competencies of ten children with disabilities and developmental difficulties will be improved, through workshops of psychologists, speech therapists and physiotherapists at the Association," said Žugić.
According to her, Nikšić is becoming an example of an inclusive and responsible community. She thanked the Municipality of Nikšić for recognizing the importance of investing in the most vulnerable categories of society, and called on the public, institutions and all relevant stakeholders to join forces to contribute to creating an environment in which every child will have the opportunity to develop their potential.
The project, which lasts four months, was financially supported by the Municipality with the amount of 6.500 euros.
Bonus video:
